result.execSummary:
The defendant John D Tucker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intimidate Victim/Dissuade Reporting [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.44(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Straight time if imposed.
Consecutive to: Any other sentence.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to costs, balance to be refunded to the poster.

Maintain full time employment and/or combination of schooling.  Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent. No contact with Karen S.  DNA Sample to be provided if not yet previously done.  Domestic Violence Counseling.
 If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes:
Huber, non-working hours, with standard release conditions. Commencing FORTHWITH.
Defendant is authorized to make a phone call.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John D Tucker

records.addlTxt:
Notice of Case Status Change. Terminated - regular
  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Affidavit for Services Rendered filed by Atty Babe.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant John D Tucker in court with attorney Katie Elizabeth Babe.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 2.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Count #1 is dismissed and read in.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 11, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant John D Tucker in court with attorney Katie Elizabeth Babe.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Attorney Babe advises the Court the parties have a joint request to adjourn the trial to allow for the Defendant to complete his treatment.  The Court sets the matter for a plea hearing on Monday to allow for the parties to reached a final agreement.  The trial remains as set.  Plea hearing scheduled for January 25, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant John D Tucker in court with attorney Katie Elizabeth Babe.  Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Babe requests an adjournment of the trial to allow for additional trial preparation.  The Court denies the request and the trial remains as set.

Defendant John D Tucker in court with attorney Katie Elizabeth Babe.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Attorney Babe advises that she is waiting for files from the previous counsel. The Court sets the matter for trial. If Attorney Babe would like the case to resolve prior to the jury trial she should notify the clerk's office to make arrangements.
Defendant to pay: $100.00 Per month commencing 11/1/15.

Defendant John D Tucker in court with attorney Amy C Scholz.  Mary C. Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Motion to withdraw as counsel previously filed. Court grants motion to withdraw as counsel.   Defendant requests the court appoint counsel. Court swears defendant. Court grants request, repayment at rate of $100.00 per month commencing November 1, 2015.  Hearing scheduled for October 28, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 5, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant John D Tucker in court with attorney Amy C Scholz.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense has been working on a consolidation with the cases in Waukesha and Milwaukee county. Defense advises they will now resolve the cases independently. Court will give a plea/sentencing date in 45 days.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant John D Tucker in court with attorney Amy C Scholz.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense is still working to consolidate the defendant's matters and requests another date. Court grants request.  Hearing scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant John D Tucker in court with attorney Amy C Scholz.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for June 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster.  Defendant is not to have any violent contact with the victim/witness listed in the complaint.   Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.

Defendant John D Tucker in court.  Timothy F. Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  State has offer to amend charge upon defendant doing counseling. Defendant would like to accept the states pre-trial offer.  Hearing scheduled for June 15, 2015 at 10:00 am.
